p: A 71 year-old male presented with a pharyngocutaneous fistula on the background of a stage 4 (T4aN2M0) right piriform fossa Squamous Cell Carcinoma (SCC) managed with laryngectomy, partial pharyngectomy, bilateral neck dissections, and reconstruction of a neopharynx using an ALT flap. The patient received 56Gy post-operative radiotherapy and adjuvant chemotherapy.
